channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Joyful Day of the Dead commemorations rally US Latino communities despite immigration raid fears
item.description: Day of the Dead commemorations in early November are a crucial religious, family and community celebration for most Mexicans and many other Latin Americans.
item.dc:creator: Giovanna Dell’Orto, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Hegseth declines to discuss possible US strikes in Venezuela, blames Dems on troop pay amid shutdown
item.description: Secretary of War Pete Hegseth declined to say whether the U.S. is preparing military strikes on Venezuela, while blasting Democrats over the shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Former Kentucky Gov. Martha Layne Collins has died at 88
item.description: LEXINGTON, Ky. (AP) — Martha Layne Collins, the first and only woman elected governor of Kentucky, died on Saturday. She was 88.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Uncertainty over federal food aid deepens as the shutdown fight reaches a crisis point
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The crises at the heart of the government shutdown fight in Washington were coming to a head Saturday as the federal food assistance program faced delays and millions of Americans were set to see a dramatic rise in their health insurance bills.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Daylight saving time: These states want to stop changing the clocks
item.description: Nearly every state has considered legislation that would lock the clocks — here's where those efforts stand.
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: FBI raid at Idaho horse track shows how immigration is a top focus across law enforcement
item.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — The first sign something was amiss was the thwack of helicopter rotors overhead, followed by screams.
item.dc:creator: REBECCA BOONE, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: How does 'doomscrolling' actually affect us? Experts weigh in
item.description: While it may feel relaxing to put one's mind on pause and endless scroll the feed of a favorite app, experts are urging people to beware of certain warning signs.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tanner, KRON4

item.title: Federal judge rules Trump can’t require citizenship proof on the federal voting form
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President Donald Trump’s request to add a documentary proof of citizenship requirement to the federal voter registration form cannot be enforced, a federal judge ruled Friday. U.S. District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON and NICHOLAS RICCARDI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Police investigating break-in at home reported to belong to NBA star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander
item.description: Police on Friday were investigating a burglary at a home reported to belong to the Oklahoma City Thunder’s Shai Gilgeous-Alexander that happened while the NBA's reigning MVP was playing a game the night before.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Trump signals he'll fund SNAP
item.description: President Trump indicated Friday he would fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) if given "the appropriate legal direction" after a federal judge ordered officials to spend an emergency fund for the program.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Republican leaders reject Trump's demands to scrap the Senate filibuster to end the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Back from a week abroad, President Donald Trump threw himself into the shutdown debate, calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster and reopen the government, an idea swiftly rejected Friday by Republican leaders who have long opposed such a move.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO and MARY CLARE JALONICK, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday moved to limit the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children's teeth, the latest action by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his deputies against a chemical that is a mainstay of dental care.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW PERRONE, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Ramen instead of Reese's? Looming SNAP cuts change what's on offer for Halloween trick-or-treaters
item.description: When KC Neufeld announced on her Denver neighborhood’s Facebook page that her family would be handing out ramen and packs of macaroni and cheese in addition to candy this Halloween, she wasn't expecting much of a response.
item.dc:creator: HALLIE GOLDEN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs transferred to New Jersey prison to serve 4-year prostitution-related sentence
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Sean “Diddy” Combs has been transferred to a prison in New Jersey to serve out the remainder of his four-year prison sentence on prostitution-related charges.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: ICE officer shoots illegal immigrant during Phoenix traffic stop gone wrong, both hospitalized
item.description: ICE officer and Honduran man injured in Phoenix shooting during traffic stop. Jose Garcia-Sorto hospitalized in stable condition after Interstate 17 incident.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: When will SNAP EBT cards be reloaded? Delays still possible despite judges' rulings
item.description: Just hours before the looming deadline, two judges ruled Friday that the federal government must continue funding SNAP during the government shut down. However, those expecting food assistance on Nov. 1 may still see delays.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Scammers targeting owners of lost pets in Indianapolis
item.description: The caller told her they found her cat but that it had been hit by a car and that she needed to pay for surgery to get it back.
item.dc:creator: Charles Benberry, NewsNation

item.title: Death row inmate Stephen Bryant chooses firing squad execution after admitting to gruesome murder
item.description: South Carolina death row inmate Stephen Bryant chooses firing squad execution for Nov. 14, becoming the third this year to select the method.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: South Carolina man chooses execution by firing squad despite concerns over last death by bullets
item.description: COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) — A man on death row in South Carolina who taunted investigators with messages written with a victim's blood chose Friday to die by firing squad. Stephen Bryant, 44, will be the third man this year to die by South Carolina's newest execution method. His execution is set for Nov.
item.dc:creator: JEFFREY COLLINS, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: California man accused of raping woman who was seeking immigration help
item.description: “The suspect offered the victim $400 and a discount on her case if she did not contact police,” authorities added.
item.dc:creator: Josh DuBose, NewsNation

item.title: Escaped monkeys from Mississippi truck crash puts spotlight on NIH-funded Tulane lab
item.description: Three monkeys remain at large after truck crash in Mississippi released 21 primates from Tulane University research program allegedly funded by NIH, sparking public safety concerns.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: California animal shelter rescues nearly 100 small pets from single home
item.description: The organization took in 31 mice and 63 hamsters, some of which are pregnant and expected to give birth soon.
item.dc:creator: Lily Dallow, NewsNation

item.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two judges could rule as soon as Friday on whether President Donald Trump's administration must replenish SNAP food aid benefits for November despite the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Haven't gotten a Facebook settlement check? Here's what to do
item.description: Millions of people owed a piece of the massive $725 million Facebook privacy settlement have been receiving their payments.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, WFLA, NBC

item.title: JetBlue flight to New Jersey makes emergency descent, injuring as many as 20 passengers
item.description: Fifteen to 20 passengers were injured on a JetBlue flight heading to Newark, New Jersey. The flight was diverted in Florida due to a control issue experienced by the flight crew, according to officials.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Euzarraga, KRON4

item.title: Black vultures attack and kill cattle. Climate change is one reason they're spreading north
item.description: EMINENCE, Ky. (AP) — Allan Bryant scans the sky as he watches over a minutes-old calf huddled under a tree line with its mother. After a few failed tries, the calf stands on wobbly legs for the first time, looking to nurse. Above, a pair of birds circle in the distance.
item.dc:creator: JOSHUA A. BICKEL and MELINA WALLING, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Republicans battling behind scenes over funding SNAP during shutdown
item.description: Cracks are forming in the Senate GOP conference over whether benefits under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) should be allowed to lapse this weekend.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, WGN 9

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and other content from YouTube TV amid breakdown in talks
item.description: YouTube TV viewers can no longer see Disney channels, including ABC and ESPN, after the two sides failed to agree on a new content distribution deal.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Cannabis use may boost tobacco addiction risk in young Americans, study finds
item.description: New research from UC San Diego found that cannabis use among youth may be responsible for 13% of new cases of regular tobacco use in the US, suggesting that cannabis use should be considered a major risk factor for later tobacco addiction.
item.dc:creator: Amber Coakley, KRON4

item.title: Photos: Trumps host Halloween event at White House
item.description: President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump hosted trick-or-treaters on Thursday in a Halloween celebration that has become a fun White House tradition.
item.dc:creator: The Hill, WFLA, NBC

item.title: House Republicans grow anxious about Speaker Johnson's extended shutdown recess
item.description: House Republicans are growing anxious about how they will make up for lost time after Speaker Mike Johnson’s (R-La.
item.dc:creator: Emily Brooks, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Dallas-native pulls 1-of-1 Shohei Ohtani autograph on spontaneous card shop trip after father has a stroke
item.description: (WGN) — In the grand scheme of things, Rick Fayter and his son are a lot like other father-son duos across the country.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: See it: NYC streets submerged as torrential rain hits the city
item.description: NEW YORK (PIX11) -- Heavy rain has hit New York City, causing significant flooding across the boroughs. The National Weather Service issued a flood warning for Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and the Bronx on Thursday afternoon through 5:30 p.m.
item.dc:creator: Video credit: Eileen Lehpamer, NewsNation

item.title: Pair get prison for assaulting restaurant host over where they were seated
item.description: The teenager who was attacked said the trouble began after he finally got them all seated at the one large table.
item.dc:creator: Sarai Bennett, NewsNation

item.title: UPS cuts 34K jobs in year to date amid turnaround
item.description: United Parcel Service posted third-quarter results that handily beat Wall Street's expectations and gave details about its turnaround efforts, including approximately 34,000 job cuts.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5
